newsitem.title: USA: Winnebago Q3 hurt by soft motor home market.
newsitem.headline: Winnebago Q3 hurt by soft motor home market.

text.p: Winnebago Industries Inc, the motor home and recreational vehicle company, said results for the third quarter and first nine months of fiscal 1997 ending May 31 were hurt by softness in the motor home segment of the recreational vehicle market.
The company also said results were hurt by the performance of its Class A motor home products in the marketplace.

"As a result of these two conditions, we reduced our production schedule in the third and fourth quarters in order to keep inventories in line with expectations," chief executive officer Fred Dohrmann said in a news release.
"Long-term prospects for the future remain bright, however, as we continue to develop products to meet the increasing demands of the vast 'baby boom' market segment," he said.
Dohrmann said the 1998 model year will include several innovative new products in the Class A and C motor home lines.
"We feel certain these new products will lead to further enhancement of our Class C market share and initiate recovery of our Class A market share in the coming year," he said.
Winnebago reported income of $3.7 million or $0.15 a share for the quarter versus $5.4 million or $0.21 a share.
Winnebago shares were down 1/8 at 7-1/8 Thursday.
